section.name: Welcome to Aozan

div.style: float: right; margin: 0 10px 20px 20px; padding: 5px; border: 1px solid #999; background-color: #eee;

section.p: Aozan has been developped in order to automatically handle data transfert, demultiplexing conversion, quality control and the contamination detection once a HiSeq run has been finished. Through most computer infrastructures and the creation of a run samplesheet, Aozan is able to get at the end of each run a whole data quality reporting in order to evaluate each sequencing parameter. This software is involved in the primary data analysis and produce compressed fastq files from an HiSeq sequencer output.
Aozan helps to greatly improve efficiency with run data management and to keep tracks of run statistics with several automatic mail information and HTML web pages.

section.name: Samplesheet validator
section.p: We provide also a CASAVA/bcl2fastq samplesheet validator to help users to check their run design. This tool use only html and javascript. When you use this tool, no data is sent to our servers.

subsection.name: Control quality with FastQC and enhancement.
subsection.p: The control quality steps contains an additional FastQC module named "Bad tiles" that search tiles with BMS (Bottom Middle Swath) issues with Illumina flowcell v3. This report is used in further analysis during the read filtering step to discard these bad tiles.

img.alt: module overrepresented sequences with results from blastn

subsection.p: Optional, Aozan adds a sub-step in FastQC for complete the module Overrepresented sequences. For sequences with "no hit", a blastn can be launch with this sequence to estimate the source. If blastn returns a hit with 100% identity and 0% gap, the result has been included in report.

subsection.name: Detection contamination with FastQ-Screen
subsection.p: Uses the principles from FastQ Screen. Maps reads on a list of reference genomes for assessing sample contamination and on the genome of the sample. Creates a report file with values for each genome. This step assesses the sample contamination from the fastq files. To do Aozan uses the principles from FastQ Screen.

subsection.name: Reading binary interOp Illumina files
subsection.p: Run data are retrieved by parsing Illumina InterOp Binary Metric files. The control quality report lists this data for each read in the run like in this example.

subsection.name: Synchronization continuous of HiSeq data
subsection.p: Enable continuous synchronization of working runs at each Aozan launch to avoid a big synchronization at the end of the runs.
